description.narrative: To support business survival and sustain employment in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, through temporary tax relief, and improve taxpayer services in the Republic of Moldova

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Private sector Advisory Panel | Description :No later than ninety (90) days after the Effective Date, theRecipient/Borrower shall, through the STS, establish and operate, throughout Project implementation, a private sector advisorypanel vested with the responsibility to facilitate citizen engagement in the implementation of Project activities, with terms ofreference and membership acceptable to the Association/Bank, as described in the POM. | Due Date :31-Oct-2016

STS, shall: (a) operate and maintain the Project Implementation Unit (PIU), review and verify the Annual Reports on the achievementof the PBCs/DLIs, and recommend payments for approval, all acceptable to the Association and described in the Project OperationalManual; and (b) ensure that any staff of the PIU financed out of the Credit is hired in accordance with Section III of thisSchedule.

STS, shall: (a) operate and maintain the Project Implementation Unit (PIU), review and verify the Annual Reports on the achievementof the PBCs/DLIs, and recommend payments for approval, all acceptable to the Bank and described in the Project Operational Manual;and (b) ensure that any staff of the PIU financed out of the Loan is hired in accordance with Section III of this Schedule.

title.narrative: Time required to comply with taxes
Number of hits to the STS web-site
The Training Distance Learning System for the most important workflows developed

baseline.value: The list of training programs is not identified

target.value: All identified distance learning courses to support for the most important workflows are developed and updated.

actual.value: All (12) identified distance learning courses to support the most important workflows were developed.

title.narrative: Ensured that supplies of goods by insolvent subjects are taxed with VAT on the reverse charge principle (PBC/DLI 2)

baseline.value: Due to the legal gap in provisions which stipulates the process of debt cancellation, at the time transfer of collected VATinsolvent subject does not have liquidity and this creates budget losses.

target.value: The adopted changes to the Tax Code came into effect

actual.value: The adopted changes to the Tax Code came into effect

target.value: Satisfaction increase - 10% (compared to baseline)Final survey conducted with data disaggregated by gender. Results and suggestedactions of the STS to address weaknesses are published on the STS website.

actual.value: Baseline survey conducted. Next and final survey is planned for the second half of 2022.

title.narrative: PBC: Introduced an Electronic Taxpayer Survey Tool

baseline.value: No tool for taxpayers’ regular feedback is in place.

actual.value: The e-taxpayer survey tool was piloted and put into operation

title.narrative: Increased nominal value of the specific and minimal excise for all tobacco products under tariff position 240220 (PBC/DLI 1)

baseline.value: Specific rates and minimum rates by types of tobacco products as set up in the Tax Code of Moldova in 2017

target.value: Increased specific rates came into effect (DLR 1.3)

title.narrative: PBC: Improved the usability of the STS website

baseline.value: There are two websites available (one for information only and another one for the submission of tax declarations by taxpayers);there are some gaps in the functionality of both websites.

target.value: New STS website is used by taxpayers

actual.value: New STS website is used by taxpayers

title.narrative: PBC: Strengthened the capacity of the STS staff to deliver taxpayer services

baseline.value: There is no a Manual on Taxpayer Services, the staff had no specific trainings.

target.value: All eligible staff of the STS, located in all offices, are trained (DLR 4.2).

actual.value: The Manual is implemented and all eligible staff of STS located in all offices was trained

title.narrative: Assigned tasks to inspectors are completed and monitored continuously
Established legal frameworks and transparent mechanisms for implementing the temporary tax relief to businesses to mitigate for thenegative fiscal impact of the COVID-19 pandemic (PBC 7)

baseline.value: Legal frameworks for mechanisms to sustain tax revenue collection through support to business continuity that ensured transparencyare not available

target.value: Report on VAT refund program covering payments made for applications received from start of program until December 2020 ispublished (DLR 7.6.)

actual.value: Legal frameworks have been established. Report on payroll subsidies program is made public. Reports on VAT refund program awaited.

title.narrative: Maintained employment and business survival in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, by temporarily providing tax relief (PBC 6)

baseline.value: No government programs to support business continuity and sustain employment in the context of COVID-19 pandemic

target.value: At least 75% of beneficiary firms that received subsidies based on expanded VAT refund mechanism from October 1 to November 30,2020 continue to operate in December 2020 and maintain reported employment on at least 60% level compared to April 2020 (DLR 6.5)
